## Objectives
1- To identify what are metadata and its types
3- To take part in understanding what are the community standards and how to use them for data and metadata
4- To define what is data proveneance
5- To illustrate what is rich metadata and how to use them
6- To explain how to explicitely use rich metadata to describe your data

### Community standards
(A1) (Meta)data are retrievable by their identifier using a standardised communications protocol
1- Definition of standard communication protocol
2- Types 
(R1.3)	meta(data) meet domain-relevant community standards
### Provenance
(R1.2)	meta(data) are associated with detailed provenance
### Rich metadata
(F2)    	data are described with rich metadata (defined by R1 below)
(R1)	meta(data) are richly described with a plurality of accurate and relevant attributes
### Vocabularies are FAIR
  (I2)     	(meta)data use vocabularies that follow FAIR principles
(I1)     	(meta)data use a formal, accessible, shared, and broadly applicable language 
for knowledge representation
### Linked metadata
    (I3)     (meta)data include qualified references to other (meta)data
### Metadata have multiple attributes
(R1)	meta(data) are richly described with a plurality of accurate and relevant attributes
